I agree w/other reviewers about the steak frites - it's not gorgonzola butter. The steak was good but I wanted the gorgonzola. I won't order that again for that reason. 

I think it's a good addition to the local restaurant scene.
Delicious coffee and a great atmosphere! I'll need to come back to sample the MANY enticing small bites so well displayed.

There can be a long wait at the pharmacy for new scripts but once your just refilling the drive thru window is great. Pharmacists seem to know theie stuff- especially the one at night.  I love that it's 24 hours- super convenient.

I have been to this place twice and each time was very enjoyable.  The service is friendly and spot on with a hostess that keeps things moving.  You don't have to wait for a table, if sitting at the counter is your thing; seat yourself immediately.  The food choices are limited, but so very flavorful that your taste-buds will congratulate you on any choice you make.  I've had the pulled pork over waffles and that is so tasty and satisfying!  The coffee is your standard coffee, although they're Spanish Coffee is really, really good!  

Our wait time was 30 minutes on a Sunday just before the church crowd; but once we were seated, the server came right over and took our order.  The wait for the food was average and the plate was warm and the food was even warmer.  I've yet to get a meal served "hot" in any restaurant.  I would tell you not to be in a hurry if you come here, because that ain't gonna happen and you'll be sorely disappointed.  However, on a lazy weekend afternoon, this is the place for brunch!

It has a **Sephora** now so the suck level fell dramatically. Rest assured, the mall still sucks.  At least now there's reason to go.

Salesman was nice.  I bought a nice watch at a fair price.  I had to wait around a while for him to take care of other customers, then I had to come back another day to pick the watch up for the discount.  Annoying but I'll return if I need to.

One my my favorite spots in all of Portland. Eat here. Eat here often. 

The burgers are creative and flavorful. The sandwiches are unique and delicious. The staff rules. I can't say enough good things.

The food and service was great! I had the filet and it was cooked perfectly! I also had the lobster bisque and it lacked flavor which is the only reason I am giving this place four stars. It's a little pricey but is great for a nice date night

I was really excited to try this restaurant.  We started off by ordering two glasses of Montepulciano wine at $19 per glass.  When the waitress brought the glasses, I was shocked and disappointed at the size of the pour.  My disappointment continued when I tasted the wine and discovered a the wine was good but not great. I tried to ignore being overcharged for a small pour of mediocre Montepulciano, but the irritation plagued the entire meal. The beet salad was very good. The pasta dishes were good, but I've had better. We split the beef cheek entree and it was excellent. The service was very good.  Parts of our dining experience were great, but i couldn't get past being charged $19 for a 4oz pour of mediocre Montepulciano wine   I won't go back.
The course was in terrible shape whenwe played on Saturday, it was overbookedwith no rangers out to keep play moving. Iuse to play there twice a month but not now until they repair the course.
Best chocolate in the city, beautiful cakes. My absolute favorite is the almond croissant.

We visited Oba for dinner on a Sunday night.  They have a great deal for wines on Sundays, half off all bottles $65 and up.  We opted for a pitcher of sangria.

We started with the ceviche, arepas, and empanadas.  Arepas were my favorite because they were full of flavor.  Empanadas hit the spot, but I've had better in my travels.  Ceviche was ok,

The one item that brought down the review was the paella.  There was no flavor or spice.  Even the chorizo was bland.  I would recommend skipping the paella.

For dessert, we had the banana cheese malasadas.  They were a great finish to dinner and just the right size.

Service was great, but there are other good restaurants in Portland I would visit before I come back to Oba.

The staff was super quick, accurate and friendly to boot. Atmosphere was clean and clutter free. However the tofu in my bowl was burnt to a crisp. Maybe I just caught them on an off day. I'll give them another chance since everything else was great.

Started off promising with the sun choke and spinach and bravas, but everything after was disappointing. The rice in the paella was undercooked, the flank steak was chewy instead of tender, the jambon was smoky but otherwise tasteless and not paired with anything. Most of the other dishes were oversalted, and the ahi tuna tasted off. Server seemed overwhelmed and did not ask what was wrong when food was left untouched. Food came out quickly. Maybe it was an off night because it was extremely crowded and I had heard good things.

The staff are lovely as is the food and service.
 This Restaurant does so much for the community of Mt Dora. Great atmosphere, romantic waterview dinning, music and good cheer at the friendly bar run by Mike the best bartender in mt dora. Highly recommend.
Excellent blue cheese burger, solid wings.  Wedge salad was good too.  Service really shined.  Very happy to have a great dinner option on West 2222.
this is one of the better tim horton's that i have been to. I go here for lunch on occasion and the service is good and food is better than most tim hortons in the lower mainland.

I absolutely LOVE this place. My first and best experience of Cuban food in Orlando. Coming from south Florida where Cuban food is its own food group, I'm critical. But this place is spot-on for me. The sandwiches, the entrees, it's all good. The croquetas I have to say though, are not the traditional-style treats you'd typically find in Miami but still delicious to me.

The cleaning has been anywhere from okay to good but it's pretty inconsistent. The customer service however was good and I enjoyed my visits for the most part. Unfortunately, Adam (the owner) tends to decide to not show up and open the store or decides to close hours before the stated closing time. I've had it happen to me now twice in the last month (a few others in the year) and each time there hasn't even been so much as a note on the door. Just lights off, no notice. If you decide to use this place, make sure you call ahead, even if the hours state they are open. 

Came here originally based on yelp reviews and now leaving my own.

We got lots of carbs: 

Mentaiko (Chewy pasta with cod roe on menu) 4/5: SO GOOD-Perfect balance of butter, umami, and spicy on the al dente pasta (tastes like decent pasta), with a little seaweed topping. I was the only one at our table that liked/loved it because I love creamy pasta, and they don't like butter, so if you like buttery, rich pastas, get this! The sauce is a little bit chunky/grainy and it would nice nice if there's a bit more seaweed to flavor and not just garnish, but otherwise absolutely delicious.

Okonomayaki 3/5: Delicious, generous size portioned, but sauce a bit too thick on top and I couldn't taste any shrimp or pork as advertised on the menu. The dough texture was kind of sticky and mushy--Not sure if it's supposed to be like that but I didn't like that aspect. It was fine and I could see it being a filling but small carb-loaded meal for one, but didn't live up to all the expectations I had after watching skilled chefs make it on TV. If you haven't had it before, skip it here and try it somewhere else, I will too!

Omusoba 3/5: Perfectly fried and seasoned egg blanket, but the noodles inside taste like greasy Chinese takeout, and ruined the crispy egg exterior. Good overall, but not great.

Sashimi Carpaccio 2/5: 6-7 slivers of sashimi on a bed of shaved radish and garnished with micro kale. Looks cute and fancy but no, a scam for $9.95, and didn't taste super fresh.

Riceless sushi roll thing (forgot the name but picture attached) 3/5: Medley of little bits of raw fish (sashimi scraps hello) and some cucumber, on top of a bed of radish. Interesting and my first time having raw fish rolls without rice-pretty good flavor, but nothing mind blowing. I honestly really like the shaved radish. 

We really wanted to get the Kobore for some fresh uni and a DEAL but they said they ran out and would substitute uni with eel and we were like never mind. Bummer. 

My friends had a ramen which I didn't touch and it was cheap at $8 for a pretty big bowl and they said comparable to Santouka and stuff around Boston.

Ambiance: Not really that well maintained in terms of cleanliness, which is concerning given that this place serves raw fish. I get that real Izakayas aren't sparkling clean, but I'm still concerned. 

Other comments: Valet parking for $5 on a pouring, raining day was so worth. The guy that takes phone calls ( I think he's the owner?) is pretty cool and trendy ( in Puma sneakers lol), and friendly with the customers, but is a bit slow when you make reservation/confirm details probably because the restaurant is so just make sure to confirm your reservation details. 

Overall verdict: Uncertain-I don't think there's anything like this around here and the food was pretty good, but I'm just concerned about freshness here. I'll come back to try the Kobore sushi (and make sure when I make reservation they will have it LOL) and if it turns out unfresh I'll probably just keep coming back to try the cooked foods.

Great Store.......BUT, if you don't shop there for 6 months, all your loyalty points get nuked....a pretty RAW deal.  For an added bonus...no empathy whatsoever from the management there.....I'll stick with Liquor Mart....

Everyone loves this place! I DON'T! 

Okay, if you are gonna card everyone.. please card everyone! Not just some. 

My bartender was no where to be seen once i ordered my drink and food...my drink was empty...and i was dying for water..or another drink... my friend had to get up..and walk to the other end of the bar to get us a drink. After we got ours...this asshole comes back. Do we need anything? NO. 

Gives us our bill..tries to take it when it's obvious we are trying to figure out how much we each owe.. like come on..i know you are trying to get off work, but it's a snow storm and i'm pretty sure you were just going upstairs to sleep in your free room at the marriott. 

My mojito was good..but very very...light. I swear, there was like no alcohol in it.
Fantastic tacos, not fancy but delicious and very reasonably priced.  Routine take-out spot.

We have been coming to Kobe religiously each time we visit Orlando. It saddens me to see the quality and the quantity of food at this restaurant greatly diminish. Portions were cut down, chefs weren't doing the usual tricks, and the quality of food had declined. We'll probably return because its been our tradition, but will I be keeping an eye out for other Hibachi places? Yes.

My husband and I came here after going to The Oasis as it was a zoo there and we could not eat, not to mention horrible customer service . We arrived 30 minutes before closing and were welcomed in by Cristian. Let me just say AMAZING FOOD, AMAZING CUSTOMER service!!!! Like Wow factor! This place is a must if you want excellent , authentic and inexpensive food. I had the fettuccine Alfredo and hubby had the chicken parmigiana and please please try the bruschetta appetizer. The only place between Austin and Houston so far that does it RIGHT!  Leave the fancy clothes at home and go enjoy a REAL meal here. By far the BEST restaurant we came to on our weekend visit to Austin! Thank you again Cristian!!!! Please come to Houston Mandola!

This is a typical Einstein Bros. Bagels with the same menu offered nationwide.  The staff was friendly and very quick and efficient.  The place was empty on a Friday morning from 9-10:30 and I found it rather odd, given that Einsteins is a breakfast place. 

My wife ordered the bagel with Lox, onions, and cream cheese. She said it was pretty good, but it could have used a bit more cream cheese. I ordered the Chicken Panini with artichoke and it was very tasty.  We both ordered a strawberry lemonade and thought it was made to order, but when the attendant handed us our food she mentioned the strawberry lemonade is kept in the cooler section along with the milk, OJ, and cream cheese. 

My wife mentioned the place was rather cold inside, and it felt a tad unwelcoming because of it.  The restroom is a one-bloke-at-a-time type of deal, so if the place is busy, you may have to wait to use the facilities.  

Overall, it was a good experience, but nothing to rant and rave about.  If you're hungry and you're in the area you can stop in for a quick meal that is slightly overpriced.  Don't make a drive just to eat here, though.  It's just not that type of place.
This review for manager Jacob. My online was done wrong I didn't get the food I ordered. Jacob went above and beyond to correct mistake and make my experience awesome..faith restored in costa Vida

Closed? Can't Be. I have to write this review as a memorial anyway.

I have been here on maaaaaany occasions. 

How to decide if you would like the Hong Kong:
1) do you like kareoke? If yes, then stay downstairs, sign yourself and your buddies up, and sing away on stage. 
2) do you like dancing to pop music and whatever else you'd like to request? If yes, then go upstairs where there is a second bar and a dj spinning melodies you can groove to.
Finally, 3) do you like meat on a stick? 

Okay, i don't enjoy myself some meat on a stick. BUT, my vegetarian friend has been known to get drunk and end up purchasing a $1 beef teriyaki on a stick from the waiters who wander the Hong Kong with these fares in a little metal bucket.

How could you not love all this?

Fantastic selection of food for vegetarians.  Their guava &  cheese taqueneous are great.  Be careful when eating them as the guava jam can drip on your fingers and clothes if you are not careful.  The one complaint I would have is to ensure that they are heated evenly.  In one of the taqueneous the cheese was a bit cold.

Their juices are great and fresh.  I had their mango juice - delicious!  I also ordered the vegetarian plate which had roasted vegetables.  I ordered three sides - the plantains, black beans and rice.  All were great and just amazing.  For folks that love hot food, ask for their complementary hot sauce.  It was hot, even for me!  Just a great experience overall.  I would come back in a heartbeat!

I dine at Lucca on a fairly regular basis and have never been disappointed with the food or the service.  The wait staff is great and always have excellent recommendations on the food as well as wine.

Great food at a reasonable price and comfortable atmosphere.  I highly recommend.

I really like the staff and Dr. Bolerjack.  My kids are both in the process of getting their teeth straightened out.  They do a great job and I have recommended them to lots of other parents who are looking for an honest, professional, friendly staff and orthodontist.  We liked Dr. Dykes and I wasn't sure how they would do with a new Dr. but Dr. Bolerjack is great.  My kids love his approach and his fun attitude.  He makes them laugh and they no longer complain when we have to go in.

Wooden crates with plastic exterior were used to stuff the electronics into, and other things that required sturdy support to not move around and get damaged. They brought the different types of crates they had ready to be used and had us choose the ones we wanted. Thankfully the bundle we had purchased included two or three different types, and each one was for a different type of material. Clothes were put into the cardboard boxes and the fragile things were in the plastic crates with a soft interior that was custom padded. Great service.

Crowds make me nervous so I won't be dining in here any time soon, but with a little help from Eat Out In I can enjoy my favorites in comfort! I really liked the avocado fries, piping hot with a crisp peppery coating, creamy and delicious inside. The buttermilk mashed potatoes were a little bland but wonderful with a bit of cream gravy. And Wom Kim's Peach Pudding is rich and sweet and flavorful, a bit heavy but great comfort food.

Quaint little store with tons of amazing items! We purchased a cabinet from them and it looks amazing in our house. They are very helpful and always adding new inventory. If you let them know you are looking for a certain item, they will FB message you when they have new stock coming it! I like that customer attention! Makes me a BIG fan of this store. Can't wait to find my next piece.

This was our third time having Ethiopian food, but our first time at this restaurant.  We had a great experience and loved the dishes.  We had the Habesha special and added on a spicy beef dish.  The injera was soft and plentiful.  We will definitely go back and take friends who want a unique dining experience.  The staff were lovely as well!
Excellent work on a small surface (ladys watch) friendly, quick, reasonable price. Would def use again/recommend~~!!

I spent four nights here.

Pros:
¬∑Great location. Walk distance to everything, T blue, orange and green line, little Italy, Quincy Market and Downtown area. It's safe to walking around until 11pm or so.
¬∑Friendly staff makes me feel like I was warmly welcomed.
¬∑Yoga mat in every room.

Cons:
¬∑I live in the 10th floor, which is the top floor for customers. I always hear noise during the night, not because of the AC system or disturbing by other customers, it's a weird electronic sound, every uncomfortable.
¬∑Facial tissue is empty.

PS
¬∑No free Wi-Fi for non-member customers, the price is $12.99/night for three device access.

Horrible for oil change! Set up a reservation online for a fixed time, but apparently that means nothing!!! Still have to wait for more than an hour..

I went to waffle house across the street, waited in line,  ate breakfast,  got back and they still hadn't started on my car!

So glad we experienced Roe; will likely not return.  Speakeasy feel with hidden entrance to back room through other restaurant.  Gourmet food, tiny servings.  Would they hold up in larger servings?  They accommodated our Gluten Free diner with ease, but reduced our options to only the 5-course dinner.  They couldn't accommodate a fish-eating vegan, but dairy was minimal.  Wine flight was interesting, with unusual pairings; well worth doing.  Service was amazing, with lots of explanations of wine & food.  We loved the cold smoked salmon, which was new to us.  Crab risotto was another winner.  Sad to report the dessert was disappointing, so the dining experience ended with a thud, not a bang.  On the pricey side, but definitely worth a try.

We visit this place at least once or twice a year because they have delicious food.  Almost always a perfect meal - this time had a lot of gristle in the lamb meat which was hard to get past.  The other dishes were quite delicious as always.  We will return again and try another adventurous dish.
This coffee shop isn't as chic and dim lit as the coffee shops I'm used to in Nashville but they have a great product and a friendly staff...and friendly staffs are hard to come by.

Very disappointed and at some points had thoughts of "is this really happening right now?". I bought a groupon for a full set of eyelash extensions with 1 fill. I go to my appointment for the full set of lash extensions. I'm right on time for my appointment and I walk up to the glass door, which is locked, but I see the woman (who I assume is going to do my lashes because she's the only one in the small room) and she is on her cell phone. She notices me when I walk up to the glass door by looking in the mirror and seeing my reflection. She continues to talk on her phone and hasn't turned around yet to face me. I knock and she still doesn't run around, but I know she's already seen me through the mirror she's staring into. I was thinking "what's going on here??" Then after about 20 seconds of me staring at her and her back turned toward me, she finally turns around and points to the chair sitting outside the glass door and when I look down I see that it has papers to fill out for first time customers. I sat down in the chair (mind you she's still on the phone and hasn't unlocked the glass door) and fill out the paper, probably taking about 2 minutes to fill out. I stand up and face the glass door and she's still on the phone, I'm standing there laughing at this point because I can't believe this is going on. Then I had to pee, so I just walked away from the glass door and went to the bathroom (this place is set up inside a building with other clinics/salons). I go to the bathroom, walk back to he glass door and she's now what it looks like saying goodbye on the phone and then unlocks the door to let me in and says "sorry". I was so mad, but didn't say anything and went on with the lash appointment. I've gotten lashes done before so I knew what to expect. Basically the outcome was mediocre (I wanted monger and told her, but they were average length) and my left eye was red and hurting for 2 days afterwards which has never happened before with pervious lash extensions from other places. I will never go back there again and seriously that woman was so rude to be on her phone ignoring me for so long when I got there ( for probably 20 minutes total)
hands down the best pad thai ive ever had.  always a must have for when im in portland.  very reasonably priced and very good portions.  love it.

Pros: The friendly parking lot attendant. The crab and asparagus dip is DELICIOUSLY rich. The wings are good. The beer selection is pretty great; I think I had the dragon's milk or something there. Ambience is pretty nice and dim; you don't feel like everyone is staring at you. The waitresses are friendly too.

Cons: SUPER busy on weeknights. If you walk in at 7:30, expect to wait for a table. The last time I was there, we had stale chips with our crab and asparagus and asked for a fresh batch. Although my waitress was nice, she charged us an extra dollar or two for the fresh chips. Kinda ridiculous since the first batch was stale.

That aside, I'll definitely come back for the food. Everything we tried (besides the chips) was delicious.

Also if you have trouble finding the place, it's right across the street from Green's on Ponce.

Grotto wasn't as hard to find as everyone said. 

I had the famous gnocchi. He had the tenderloin and risotto. Both were good. Really really good? No. Just very good. Perhaps my perception of the quality of our meal was affected by the service. 

Our waiter was really bad. Even my super-easy going companion was annoyed about it. Mike, you are really in the wrong line of work. We had actually intended to order dessert after our dinner, but after we failed to catch his eye several times over a bizarrely lengthy period of time, we opted to simply ask another server for our check. We went elsewhere for our sweets. 

The space was awesome. Sub-level, deep red, shabby chic chandeliers, pipes geometrically formed above us. Very cool.

The restaurant was very nice and clean and the staff on the day we went "Memorial Day" of all days was top notch. The servers were very attentive and even the managers stopped by the table a few times to make sure everything was to our satisfaction.
We passed on appetizers knowing we wouldn't have room for desert. My wife ordered the "Not So House Salad" which she gave rave reviews and I had the Caesar salad which was anything but. It was really good with a peppery flavor and rich creamy dressing. Both salads came with homemade cornbread and cornbread croutons throughout.
My wife ordered the Ribeye steak Medium and I had the Filet Medium Rare. The steaks were cooked to our liking and our server asked that we cut into them to confirm before he left them. Both of our dinners came with mashed potatoes and broccoli. The potatoes were good but nothing special. The broccoli however is the reason for only giving 4 stars. Broccoli should be steamed and come crisp and bright green in color to the table instead ours looked like what you would expect from Denny's, brown to grey in color and any chef with any self respect would have thrown those in the trash for a restaurant of this level.
We had the pineapple upside down cake for desert which comes warm and topped with vanilla ice cream. It was just the right size for the two of us and was exactly what I had expected from the description. It was very tasty and I would have it again except next time I'm gonna try the bread pudding which I rarely pass up.
Our bill for two was right at $100 with two cocktails that were $10 and $11 each. Not cheap but definitely not the most expensive choice for this style of restaurant.
All in all a very pleasant experience and worth the trip. We will be going again in the future.

Came here after reading all the reviews and was a bit disappointed. For eats, we ordered the now $2 burger (the avenue burger), sweet potato tots, wings (in the mind eraser and buffalo sauces), and fries. The burger was just ok - definitely no tasty burger, but good for the price. The sweet potato tots tasted burnt and was almost inedible. The wings were ok...the mind eraser sauce is made with ghost peppers and was pretty delicious, but as for the wing itself - I think Harry's fries up a better wing. The fries were good...definitely better than the tots.

As for drinks, I had the blueberry beer and my boyfriend had the allagash white and the shock top belgian white. He liked both of his beers, but my blueberry beer was just okay. The blueberry taste was really faint - the blueberry beer is a million times better at Harry's. Plus at Harry's they put real blueberries in your beer and the foam has blueberry bits in it. Call me snooty, but I like a bit of presentation and an actual blueberry taste to my blueberry beer.

The minute we walked in, we knew service would be slow. And so it was. Signs on the outside table said "see waiter to be seated", but nobody was there to seat us. After a while the waiter came, we sat outside and it took another 5-10 minutes till we got our drinks. Another 25 minutes till we got our food (chicken salad, sandwich). The salad was drenched in a red dressing, the chicken was hard to chew. The sandwich was ok. Kids pasta was seasoned with pepper (parents will understand why this is another minus...). The waiter was friendly but that couldn't make up for the overall bad experience.

Visited this establishment for a going-away party which was pre-arranged with the restaurant however when we arrived they had no seating reserved for us.  We had all bought tickets (provided by the restaurant for that time and date)  which included a burger and a beer.  Burgers were pretty tasteless, not juicy, buns were nothing special either.  The best thing I could say about it was that the fries were hot and crispy.  Some of my friends reported that the oxtail soup was also good.  Service was shoddy however and there was nothing about the experience that will be tempt me back again.

I can't say enough great things about this service.  I don't party often but when I do, I party hard.  After a wild night on Rainey Street, I woke up feeling terrible.  The very thought of leaving my hotel made me literally wretch.  While hiding under my pillow, I suddenly had a moment of clarity.  I knew that an IV hydration service was available in Las Vegas.... Austin is a party town..... what if Austin had one as well?  Enter Rolling RevIVal.... my savior.  The bus was conveniently parked on South Congress, a short distance from my hotel.  

I chose the premium service and after the obligatory snapchat videos and photos my friends took of me being hydrated, they waited for me across the street at a bar.  I hardly noticed the paramedic inserting my IV as I was chatting with Michelle.  Within 30 minutes, I was feeling utterly human.  After less than an hour, my pounding headache and nausea were gone completely. 

I'm not sure that that Rolling RevIVal officially recommends this prophylactically, but I began partying shortly after the service until 4 am (about 14 hours straight) and felt fabulous the following morning as well. 

For people like me who suffer from excruciating hangovers, this service is amazing.

This place is way overrated... Im not from the area, and my GF whos from there, gassed this place up to be something special. Went on a Friday night recently, around 8. Some lady who worked there helped us find a spot in their lot, which was a nice touch, as parking in SoBo is beyond attrocious, cars might as well be banned from parking within the city limits. We sat near the bar area...Hella loud in there, sounded like some obnoxious souls were in the vicinity. Yelling and hollering and such,I mean i get it its a a bar but it was only around 8. We get seated and waited around 10m to get a waitress to our table. Service overall was really slow. After we got our decent cocktails, another 15-20m passed before we got approached to order meals. 

As for the food, we decided to just get entrees. My Gf got the pork chop and it seemed to crisped on the outside, almost burnt. Her risotto was decent, but overall it was lackluster. I was gunna opt for the prime rib, they were out of it at the time. No biggie I had a lobster pie in the on deck circle...So I got it, really rubbery and quite bland. The portion wasnt that great either. Not sure why I got fries with it, but I did. The fries were ok, oversalted thought. We waited another 15m after we were done for the check. When the check came, my GF and I split the bill...For the food and service we got, this place is overpriced...I heard the quality took a dive after they remodeled it, from my GF whos been going there for a while. Seems like the place is surviving on name/prior reputation and old time regulars. I wouldnt go back. Week later we went to the Lincoln Tavern up the road, and I was blown away that place was incredible and a better value.

Final note, after I ate here and checked some other reviews the night of, I stumbled across one of the restaurants customer service reps for yelp, Don. His replies were very unprofessional, belittling of the reviewer, yet entertaining, due to the fact  I couldn't believe someone who represents the establishment would write such things. I read all the poor reviews to see him go to the point of attacking the patron and accusing them of being at fault for their poor service, never seen anything like it. In this case, on a public forum its probably better to let the poor reviews stand alone, rather than make the establishment look a bush league eatery.

I am not going to comment on the food because I have been here several times and will continue to do so. So, obviously I like the food. The truffle mayo is addictive!

I want to comment on the efficiency, rather lack there of. It takes a full 10 minutes between ordering and checking out. All three people who helped put my sandwich together asked me if I wanted it toasted. It seems that should be the responsibility of either the first or second person on the assembly line, not the entire team. 

Furthermore, the cashier is the same person that writes what you ordered on the wrapper. First of all, I am dining in and I don't need that extra wrapper. Second, shouldn't that be the responsibility of the person that wraps the sandwich at the end? The cashier shouldn't have to ask the first person on the assembly line what I ordered. Yes, I mean they asked the first,  not the person that wrapped the sandwich.

Another time killer is the fact that they have to input the type of bread and cheese you ordered into the computer. The accounting of the inventory makes me think they don't trust their employees. God forbid one wheat tortilla is missing! Do the inventory at the end of the night. 

Get people in and out- that is in the best interest of all of us.

My wife and I went here on our first date for dinner and it wasn't a cheap one. The food was very good and rich, but small portions. I haven't been back since for that reason. Too expensive to leave hungry. If it doesn't take much to fill you up or please you, then go for a nice evening.

Based on the positive reviews I read for this food trailer, I bought a Groupon and I was not disappointed in the food. I had the Red Curry, Spring Rolls & Egg Rolls. My wife and I enjoyed them thoroughly.

What I did not like about the experience, was the lack of flexibility on the part of the counter staff. 

My wife and I are from Canada, we like to experiment with new restaurant experiences by using Groupons. Because we are from Canada, it costs us a small fortune for roaming data services on our cell phone. We buy our groupons, and save an image of the groupon, including the SKU/Bar Code so it can be documented by the restaurant. We have presented the image to dozens of different restaurants and the staff simply wrote down the Groupon Coupon # and proceeded with the transaction .. but NOT Trai Mai Thai .. the staff refused to allow me to use my groupon unless they could touch the screen on my smartphone to mark the coupon as "Redeemed", I explained other restaurants do not have a problem simply taking the number .. but they refused to do so. As a result, I had to delete the Groupon APP from my wife's phone (she has a limited data plan), reload the APP, sign in using my account (Groupon APP does not allow multiple accts), bring up the coupon so the counter staff could touch the "Redeem" Icon, then delete the APP, reload the APP and restore my wife's Groupon Acct. Had I known this restaurant did not have the flexibility to deal with a Groupon by writing down the Coupon #, I would have never purchased the Groupon or visited this restaurant. But, the food was great ... creates quite a dilemma, great food .. but lousy customer service!

I would rate the food as 5 Star, but given the customer service and lack of flexibility in accepting a Groupon, even though I explained our unique cell phone/data issues .. the staff could not have cared less, so overall a 3 Star is suitable.

More good news though, management quickly responded, confirmed that staff should have simply wrote down the Groupon # and new staff have been brought up to date on the procedure.

The people who work here are rude, rude, RUDE!!!!  I needed razor blades (which are locked up) and the person on the floor couldn't be bothered to help me get them, and then complained when I needed more time to figure out which ones were the right ones.  I will seriously never go in there again, if I can help it.  There 's a Walgreen's right across the street.  Go there instead, is my recommendation.  They take FOREVER, but at least they aren't rude.

Harvest is a fantastic restaurant for Harvard Square -- definitely my favorite in the very immediate area. Harvard Square isn't exactly full of fine dining options, and although I really enjoy Chipotle and Subway, sometimes you want a grilled ribeye with a truffle and potato puree with sauteed white and green asparagus topped with English pea greens and shaved summer truffle. I got that special for $38 and it was fantastic. The truffle smell and taste were exceptionally strong and the steak was a perfect medium rare. I also got the almond mocha torte for dessert which was very tasty and just the kind of light cake I enjoy. The bread is always good with a sesame cracker, corn bread, lemon raisin bread and a slice of French bread. I think the food is always very well balanced, cooked very well and has fresh ingredients. I'll eat here whenever I'm back in Cambridge.

Scenario: new to the restaurant. We walk in and are greeted by no one. Restaurant is quite empty. We aren't sure what to do so we approach the bartender and ask if we can seat ourselves. She doesn't give us a firm yes but instead says "sure." Hostess then arrives at our table and hands us two menus. Ten minutes go by and we haven't been waited on or checked in on by any one. Two gentlemen enter--are immediately seated and waitress brings them water. 20 minutes now go by. Restaurant is filling up (we know this because we are sitting in the middle of the room--front row seats). At this point we are hungry and pretty annoyed. My friend tries to flag down a waitress and she, without exaggeration, ignores her and continues on her way. 
Now please be aware that we are polite, patient people who wouldn't normally leave, but tonight we received the worst service imaginable at a restaurant. We ended up leaving still without silverware or water on our table. I wish Yelp could take away stars as this restaurant deserves less than 0 stars. 

First Yelp review for me (that's how angry I am right now). So we are at the restaurant next door enjoying a few large glasses of sangria :) Cheers!

It was restaurant week so perhaps it was over crowded. There is a lot of hype about Chef English and the restaurant did not live up to it

They sat us at a small bar table even though I booked 2 weeks in advance. 
The pasta in the appetizer was not salted properly -- is that not rule 1. Had it been, it would have been delicious - the sauce and veggies with it were really good and fresh.
The lamb main dish as a kabob but it was a huge chanka meat -- come on one knows that the flavors don't permeate with huge meat chunks. 

Service was amateurish -- no slde plates for 2 of the 4; soup was served and we had to find a waiter to get us a soup spoon.

Desserts were good.  All in All an ok place -- come on Todd you can do better --- I hope
I love that bags fly free!  I never have a problem with Southwest.  Good prices and quality service.

After my previous review I was contacted by the owner Christopher at the beginning of August. He told me how he wants to be a 5 star business and that satisfaction is supposed to be 100% guaranteed. And what he could do to make this review a better.
I gave him my phone number and email as the yelp app for iphone doesn't let you see messages. I got a call on August 6th by Lisa who I can't remember is a co owner or a manager. She explained to me that the arrangement my mom had ordered came in a bud vase so it may have just looked small and what could she do to help. Luckily she was able to find the transaction and upgraded to the next size. It was delivered on the 8th or 9th and was beautiful as said my gma.

A few reasons why this isn't upgraded to a 5 star:

1) The woman I got who answered before Lisa was named Mary. She was sort of rude and snooty. Not very professional even after I explained that I wrote a bad review and the owner was trying to contact me.

2) After I talked to my mom I realized she did a phone order. When she chose the cheapest arrangement it was not detailed as to how it would come. My mom expected something like the mug my gma got the second time around. Not a small bud vase. I believe detailed communication is key for a satisfied customer and consumer when placing a phone order.

3) I got a phone call on the day of delievery questioning if my gma was home. She is in a walker and hard of hearing. I asked Mary if he rang the doorbell and she said yes. After I called my gma and called back Mary she had said he left it with the neighbor. Umm Hello...how do you know the neighbor 
      A) will give it to my gma
      B) keep it  and pretend nothing was delivered
  I know the delivery guy did not ring the doorbell. Before my gpa died years ago a special doorbell was installed and was made loud enough to here it no matter what basically. My gma with her walker got to the door and no one was there then had to open it again once the neighbor did show up.

So...Thank You Christopher & Lisa. Much appreciation goes out to you and your hard work and wanting to make things right!

Solid dependable inexpensive food and great for a quick breakfast and lunch. I had the chicken salad sandwich (takeout) and the breakfast burrito. Both were satisfying. The waitstaff was friendly and courteous. I would recommend this place.

For Asian buffets, this stands a bit above the rest of the field in terms of quality and selection.  This buffet has mainly Chinese and Japanese items.  They have sushi freshly made and a Hibachi Grill chef that takes your order that is included with the buffet, which I thought was very well priced at $12 for adult.  I had Hibachi shrimp and scallops with fried rice (hibachi cooked).  It was very tasty, but the scallops were about the size of a hot cocoa mini marshmallow.  I did not know they harvested scallops that small!!  I did not have to wait very long, but can see how there could be a wait if it is busy as there was only 1 hibachi chef.

I also had the pot stickers and these were better than at most buffets, though they were slightly burnt.  They had a good selection of sea food and even raw oysters.  
The restaurant is pretty clean compared to others and the atmosphere is nice.
I would eat here again because of the price, quality, and selection.
I rate this place with the menu pricing at 4 stars (for buffets), 3.75 stars for the food quality and 4 stars for the selection.
Unless you are willing to wait 20-30 min for a drink, don't come here. Literally 5 people in front of me waiting for a drink and it took that long.

I am in the area for a multi day business event and was looking for a nice salon that would take walk-ins. LP exceeded my expectations - VAN - the wonderful lady that serviced my hands and toes was meticulous and made sure to do things exactly like I wanted. She not only gave me a quality pedicure, but the gel polish is so thin it almost doesn't look like gel polish. If I lived in Orlando Van and this salon would be my go to place. It is so clean, elegant, affordable, AND professional. 100% recommended

I  should have written this review sooner but its all coming back to me now! 

While on my way to the airport for our trip to Orlando, I messed up one of my toes and needed to get it fixed instantly. But the hubby said I had to wait until we got to our destination. I ended up finding this salon(thanks to my fellow yelpers) and it was not to far from our hotel. Boy did they save my toes little life!The price for a pedicure was pretty decent and even though I had just gotten one a couple days ago in VA , I decided to get another one here instead of just "repainting my toes." The technicians were really nice, the inside was clean, and they did great work on my pedicure. I ended up thinking I should have just gotten my initial pedicure here instead of getting it in VA before our trip.

This resort was incredible. The decor was genuine, the zoo in the back of the lodge, the pool area and the restaurants were amazing. Money well spent. I would come here again, next time we would stay in the villas just to see what they are like.

This place is not to be missed! My two girlfriends and I loved our massages. This is a first...we all loved the experience and thought our therapists were amazing.  I will make sure to get time there every time I come to visit Portland.

Being a regular - it'd be only fair for me to provide an updates review. 

I originally gave this place 5 stars, however, after my few past visits - the satisfaction rate has gone down. I have waited about an hour for the food to come out - something I've never encountered before...could've just been that one visit, coffee has been pretty "milky" with no actual coffee, and my pancakes during one visit we're a tad bit undercooked. 

Overall, this place is a local gem to go for a quick breakfast fix. They might have gotten some new cooks that are adjusting but this place does the trick. Don't expect fancy :) but they do get the job done every Sunday morning.

Reliable.  Friendly employees.  Yeah, its not the best coffee in town, but you know you are going to get exactly what you expect, which means quite a lot.  Too many small places have no sense of quality or consistency, so they may not clean out the machines as religiously or as well as SB.  They may pull a shot too long, and you wind up with a bitter espresso.  Not so at Starbucks.  (Or, at least rarely.)

Starbucks is a large company, yes, but it is staffed by people who seem to like what they are doing, and are treated well by the management.  As a result, they seem to care a little more about the product they slide over to you.  They are friendly, make an effort to remember customers and orders, and have minimal attitude.

Just throwing this out there, I'm pretty new to world cuisines... Indian being one of them.  I sampled some tasty Indian food while I was in Seattle (even though I got ill at one place) and was expecting the same of the buffet at The Clay Pit.  Man, was I ever let down.

Parking at one o'clock in the afternoon on a Friday was PAINFUL... we had to park a couple blocks away.  I figured it was far enough south to avoid the cluster*&$^ that is UT, but I was wrong.  Buffet had minimal offerings... only one thing I'd heard of/sampled before (a vegetable korma).  I'd been hoping for some paneer and another thing I can't quite recall the name of, but the sauce was like crack.  Yes, I tried almost everything to be had "for science" but nothing really hit the spot.  I couldn't even bring myself to go back for seconds.  The naan was paper thin, so even if I HAD had the opportunity to sample the crack-like goodness of the aforementioned dish, I wouldn't have been able to soak it up properly.  I was very unsatisfied overall.  Even the mango soupy dessert didn't sway me, there were chunks of something (not mango) in it that were creeping me out a bit.

My instinct is to give it two stars, but I've only been one time and that just seems unfair.

I rarely dine at Firehouse Subs, though in the scheme of foods, maybe I should do so more often.  Or should I?

While nothing particularly special, they certainly are a cut above "blandly generic."  The fact that they keep hot sauces (Get it?!  FIRE-house?!  HOT!!!  oh ho ho) on the counter is an added bonus.

I suppose the mitigating factor is that I could just as easily traverse to a grocery store, purchase meat, make a sandwich, and have it come out just as good, if not better.  And therein lies the problem, though this really is an issue for me with any sandwich location, and thusly why you may see this review repeated throughout the various sandwich shop locales I post on.

One of my fave spots for a good hearty Portland breakfast. Like every good breakfast place in P-town, if you don't go early there will be a wait. This place does have a fair amount of seating. Tends to attract family and they do have several high chairs available. There are often a few large parties--so if you are looking for a place to seat 8 you might be able to do it here.

The baked eggs are amazing. You can pick your toppings/fillings and they are served with a side order of yummy potatoes and really thick toast. Sanborn's is known for their German pancakes--you will not be disappointed. My personal fave is the Kelly Street Special. It is a hash with saut√©ed ground beef, onions, mushrooms, spinach and eggs with a side of potatoes and toast. Pretty good sized portion of food and I ate it all.

I love Ethiopian food. I grew up eating it. Healthy saucy mild or spicy it's Delish.  I love the spice to it. Makes you sweat but doesn't feel like eating fire.  I want to taste my food.  I really like this place. The buffet is $9 and well worth it.  I love their azifa salad.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is they always seem to use more cinnamon then I like.  The owners are very nice and the food is great.

We came on a Friday night around 8:30pm. The place was packed so we got our order to go. The service was great and the person behind the counter gave amazing recommendations. I enjoyed the peanut sauce on the lemongrass chicken sandwich. Fries were crispy and the dipping sauce was yummy. I just wish their space was bigger but no other complaints!

I'll forgive them of serving good beer in plastic cups.  the beer selection was decent, although the beer girl had to run outside to fill my cup...  I can see the outdoor space will be great in warmer months (I know the heat is coming and will stay around too long).  

we caught a live band, the sound was good and the stage just the right height...  

they take their skee ball seriously.  pics of various teams and tournaments were posted.  

this place has a simple formula that works.  nothing unique or fancy, but simple and satisfying is enough to please.

Several visits over the years to Dosa Factory, and I can never say that it wasn't worth it.  Lots of good staples, but also some creative additions (like naan pizza!) that are interesting and tasty. A wide variety of menu options, including vegetarian meals, dosas, smoothies, and desserts.  I usually get a veggie entree and some naan.  The food never comes out as quickly as I think it will, but it's always worth the wait!  

I also enjoy that there is a tiny story attached to the restaurant.  Good ingredients, some that can be hard to find at Shaws of Whole Foods.

It was my first visit to Avellino's last weekend and I had a great pizza here.  We got the Margaretta and added peperoni.  Nothing fancy but the crust is better than any other pizza place around here.  Good craft beer selection and new management will make this place a local favorite of mine for sure.

This is an excellent place to go after church for some delicious plantains, rice and beans, and meat of choice.  I got the Cuban coffee one time and, not knowing what to expect, was pleasantly surprised with how tasty it is.  It's casual and laid-back, a good place to chat.

This is my favorite store in the world (and this is also not hyperbole).  I would kill for a place like this on the better coast (e.g., East Coast).  There's snack food and healthy food and everything in between.  Toiletries, too.  Oh, and samosas and nacho cheese pump and very, very sexy employees.  The customers are very, very sexy, too.

Re: Oliver S.'s one star review.  I'm sorry that you had a less than pleasant experience at FF.  I hope that you reached out to the management and didn't just leave your comment on this site.  They're the type of folks that would want to hear from you directly, and they're also the type of folks who will respond.

I have to admit I probably wouldn't have gone here if Rich E. hadn't suggested it one day, but I'm so glad he did. Donnie's is a great meat-and-two southern place. The staff is friendly and the food is overflowing your plate, and all for VERY reasonable prices. A great place to stop and grab quick lunch alone or with a friend.

When on this side of town, if ever craving sweets. This is the place we come to. The ice creams with Cuban coffee - perfect combo. The staff are always so fun. Always helpful and never make you feel bad for requesting to taste a flavor. Only once have I come and there was a mini line out the door. That's a good sign though, went quickly. So don't let that stop you.

I had high hopes for the fried chicken smothered with gravy and yes, they did come out smothered in brown gravy, but they must've been smothered for a quite while because not a spec of crispy skin was to be found--just a slimy somewhat dried out chicken. We're talking dark meat here too. I'm sticking to the fried chicken at Carver's.

Still, I give Busy Bee 3 stars for being a good southern staple. Sides were excellent--collards, candied yams, and extra crispy okra.
I am pretty particular when it comes to my fish and chips, this place is by far the best I have tried anywhere around Portland. We will definitely be returning. Everything made fresh daily.

I'm going to add to the majority of sentiment here and tell people this place is great. I am notorious for jabbing at places that are cash only, like the entire North End. But after using this place for awhile and seeing how nice and genuine the woman and her dog are, I'm happy to pick up my perfectly starched shirts using old-fashioned greenbacks.
Great pizza! I'm a huge fan. The breadsticks are pretty good too. I would recommend this place to anyone who comes  to this area!
I really love the food here. Also, the ladies that work here are really sweet. Definitely start with the fried pot stickers. For entrees, I have yet to have a bad one.

Food was excellent, beer was flavorful and staff was great! I ordered the Sweet Heat beer and it was nothing like I've ever tasted before! Also had the burger which was fantastic along with the fries. The ambiance was also great and there was great hipster people watching.
Worst place ever, please be cautious. Worst costumer service I ever seen. Doctors are not to friendly, rough and careless, wont use it anymore and DBPR should check this place.

Went here on 1/5 and was extremely disappointed in the food but more the service. Me and my husband have been here several times because we love love love their rotisserie chicken meal. Upon sitting down we looked at the menu but we already knew what we were going to have. If you've been to Luke's you know that they have an open concept restaurant. Our server came over and took our order but upon looking around we saw that all the servers including our server, were seated at a long table on the floor eating what I suppose is their lunch. I use to work as a server and it has never been acceptable to eat in front of guest especially if they do not have their food yet. There were about 8 servers seated just eating. We got our food pretty quickly and were very excited to start eating since we love this dish so much. Unfortunately it did not taste as it normally has in the past which is AMAZING! We still ate everything but when our server came around and asked how was everything my husband asked if they had possibly changed the chicken recipe? Because it just didn't taste as it did all the other times we came. She explained that the recipe was still the same so we said ok no big deal. I saw her approach the manager on the floor to tell him about our question on the chicken recipe. He looked at me while she was talking because our server pointed to our table and he rolled his eyes like he did not want to be bothered about the situation. Plus we were the only guest at the restaurant at that time. He not once came to our table. Me and my husband were not looking for a free meal or anything free for that matter because we ate the dish. As a manager you should be concerned with all guest especially returning guest. Unfortunately we won't ever be coming here again.

So I finally have been dragged kicking and screaming into the land of fancy phones because I want to take credit cards for my business via the Square. I called ahead and briefed Rusty on what exactly I was looking for - a phone that has internet, and isn't going to be difficult to use. He spent over an hour with me explaining my options, testing to make sure the settings were correct and that I could in fact send and receive emails, and explaining all the features on my new phone. I saved 20% on my gear (case, headphones and scratch free screen protector) by bundling them. 

As I waited for him to do his thing I listened to another associate patiently explain features to other customers even telling one that by waiting a few days to purchase her new phone she could save a few bucks. All the sales people I dealt with were friendly, helpful and this was a much more pleasurable experience than I had imagined. 

For around $270 I walked out with the latest I phone and the knowledge to operate it immediately.

Thanks Rusty for being a rock star!

What a great barbershop, tucked just inside Lakeway proper. My trusty downtown barber finally moved away, forcing me to find a new one. I thought "Lakeway is booming, we have a Torchy's and a huge HEB...we must have a decent barber!" 

Liberty barbershop follows the old-school barbershop trend that seems to be resurging. I absolutely despise the chain barbershops that want to take down your personal info before giving you a haircut. Every time I think I'm desperate enough to venture to one of "those" places, I hear the fellas in front of me dutifully handing over their name, address, and phone number, and I bolt. Just cut my damn hair.

Despite the fact that this is a small, two person operation, they're packed. I watched them turn away four people during my short stint in the chair, on a random Thursday afternoon. This means utilizing their online booking system is pretty much mandatory. 

Tyler is super talkative, as are the other patrons there waiting. Three of us ended up spanning a broad range of topics in a pretty short period of time. It was a bit surreal, it genuinely felt like a neighborhood barbershop, despite this being the first time I'd ever stepped foot in the place.

Prices are very reasonable, especially given how much attention Tyler pays to your hair. We spent 7-8 minutes just discussing options for my weird shaped head, and he really put me at ease. I think I've found my new barber!

Protip: Every service is $2 off if you pay with cash!

Just passing through alone for one night and thought this two bedroom suite was way too much space for little ole me. But like a country song, you can't have too much room. 

Located just east of the Lake Buena Vista exit on I-4, there are two entrances into the resort compound. Take the first of the two or you will be rejected and told to turn around. Trust me I know this from experience.

Check in was a little frustrating as there were only two folks checking people in and four others just standing around talking behind the counters. When I finally got my turn though, Weslee was super friendly and helpful making me almost forget about the 5 minute wait.

I got upgraded to a two bedroom suite near the main gate. Easy to find in this huge complex and a quick exit when leaving. The room was fine but lacking shampoo that was quickly rectified with a call to guest services. I didn't spend much time in the room but found it quiet and comfortable. I did like the Bose system in the living room while watching some TV.

The place is loaded with things to do but I had no time to indulge. There are seven pools to choose from with three of them open until 1am. I saw some tennis courts and several inviting hammocks as well.

Checkout was quick and painless the next morning. I wouldn't hesitate to come back but would like to bring the whole family along and stay longer the next time.

Small place, nice staff, good food. I got the original pork gyro, lentil soup, and baklava. The only bad thing is my friend and I both found our gyros to be really salty, and I am one who likes a lot of salt as it is. Adding a lot of tatziki sauce helped this. I may come back to try the tomato cheese gyro sometime still and the food was generally good
$41 for a medicore mani/pedi. I'm newer to the Chestnut Hill/West Roxbury area.. does anyone recommend a better place.  One that actually CLEANS your nails?

Surprisingly they have better and much fresher tasting tuna than that of many so called upscale places in NY which is a harbor city that one expects to obviously get the first batch of sea food before it reaches more in land were fish is not very much appreciated the chicken lettuce apps were very delicious tasting as was the main course now as for the sushi itself while not the best or even mind blowing it is most certain worthy of praise for tasting so damn good also the bar man did an excellent job with the drinks not too much ice which is great and very potent all in all was very much satisfied with the experience as well as fulfilled with the food so definitely plan to come back for a visit the next time I am in town

Consistently great place for pho! The noodles are always cooked well and the broth is consistent in taste as well. 

I recommend #17, especially if you are reluctant to try any unfamiliar parts of the cow (ie tripe aka intestines). 

The menu is vast offering everything from soups to noodles to rice plates.

The bathroom is a bit dirty though... there are cobwebs in all corners and peeling paint which contrasts the cleanliness of the rest of the restaurant.

First the entrance makes no sense.. Before you get to the hostess table, there's a room with tables and guests dining.

The waiter is pretty friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. He is a little heavy on trying to get some wine at the table, but this is expected with fine dining. He proceeds to get our drinks and informs us we will be getting bread soon. Comes back and takes our app order, bread still on the way.. Comes back with the appetizer and still no bread. I don't want the bread, but it's just poor management if you cannot bring bread to the table before apps. (Yes, I used to be a server)

Calamari - It is delicious but it is not your typical calamari. It is served under an Asian slaw with no dipping sauce.
Jumbo Crab Cake - This is definitely jumbo, and definitely crab. It is one large patty with a TON of crab. This was also very good and the roulade it is served with is not bad at all.
Tempura Lobster Tail - This was good, and I am pretty sure they left it on the shell so we had no doubt that it was worth the 33 dollars. I would rather get the lobster boiled but the appetizer just came fried.

Panko-Crusted Halibut - this was the special and the fish itself was fresh, but the flavoring was on the bland side and not enjoyable
Bone-in Filet - asked for medium and got medium-well. It was dry and lacked flavor.
Filet - not bad, but was nothing to write home about. I can make this better with the right cut of meat.
Ahi-Tuna - this definitely lacked flavor, but then again the person who got it wanted it to be medium. If it is sushi grade tuna I would do medium-rare or on the rare side. I won't dock points because of flavor.

I expected way more from a fine steakhouse.. They had great appetizers but bad entrees. Step up your game please.

I stopped by this H&R Block the day of Tax day, because I had some trouble with their online filing. I've used their service for five years, and I've never had a problem until this year. So I went to H&R's website, called their online number (basically useless), and then decided to make a one hour appointment at one of their branches. Things to know about this H&R Block location:

PARKING: The lot, which is shared with other businesses in the strip mall, is absolutely tiny. So finding a spot during peak hours might be difficult. The traffic in this part of Buckhead is terrible, too. 

SCHEDULING: Even though you might be able to grab a walk-in spot, it's better to make an appointment on the H&R Block website. Super easy.

WAITING: You'll likely wait five-ten plus minutes. There are a few chairs in the waiting room and complimentary coffee. You might also listen to the receptionist and other staff members unprofessionally gossip.

SERVICE: After waiting fifteen minutes or so past my appointment time, I met with a very nice gentleman in his cubicle. I really didn't like the fact that they don't have rooms and only cubicles, because it feels uncomfortable discussing personal financial information out loud when people in the lobby can easily hear. (There's no music playing or anything, too.) 

The man that worked with me basically said that he couldn't help me because he didn't understand my W-2s. He also couldn't even offer a solution, for me. Instead, I had to pitch them to him, and he just agreed with whatever I said (and seemed to just want me gone). 

So, basically, I wasted about an hour of and a half of my time visiting this place. For next year, I plan to hire an accountant. 

Could the people here  help you with your taxes? Sure. But, I would bet other H&R Block locations or similar businesses may provide better services..

Average wine, average food, average service and average atmosphere- the price is above average for what is provided. Although I'm very disappointed and will not be back, it was one of the only places that didn't have an hour wait to eat, hence the 2 stars.

This place is the best!!! The staff was so attentive, nice, and helpful. I had the hockey and waffles which were really good! A little sweet for my liking but delicious nonetheless. Awesome bottomless coffee and free wifi!
Would recommend and will return!

The Pleasant never disappoints us! The cheese pizza is delicious! So hot and gooey it needs to be eaten with a fork and knife if you want to dig right in. The salad is delicious. The French fries are perfect. Not those cheap fries with the bumps on them. The chicken parmigiana is also delicious. The staff is awesome. Really makes you feel like you're part of the family.
Best price for gas and very capable mechanics to all your mechanical work at fair prices.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!! While I like one of your competitors and was looking forward to them tonight....THEY FAILED! I waited an hour and 45 minutes. Called them two times. No pizza. Found out they thought I was picking up. Why if I was calling? You all delivered in 15-20 minutes after hearing my story AND....you were less expensive, same pizza toppings. YOU ALL ARE GREAT! Many thanks. Too bad it tool almost 2.5 hours for my dinner. I should have called you first!!!

Everything about my experience at iFly was excellent. My coach, Benji, helped me practice my turns and feel more relaxed so I could complete my AFF. Without that tunnel time I probably would not have been able to complete my level 6 and 7 jumps yesterday. Ben was a great coach, he was very patient with me, and very energetic. He's a great flyer too! 

The facilities are very clean here, and scheduling my time was a very easy process. This is great for all kinds of people whether you are experienced in skydiving or if you're to scared to even think about getting in the sky. Even little kids are welcome here. There were a few children at the age of 4 flying! 

This is a great experience that everyone should try out sometime no matter your age or experience level.

If you'd like to watch my video from the tunnel you can go to youtube to see it - http://youtu.be/q478cfWnUAs

Hands down this is the best Ethiopian food in Atlanta.  I have tried various Ethiopian places in Atlanta and Florida, but Desta takes the cake.

If you have never had Ethiopian before this is a great place to start.

Recommendations:
Fish Tibs
Chicken Tibs
Shiro
Vege Combo
Salad
Injera (bread)
Kifto Wrap (raw beef)-personal favorite, filled with jalapenos and cheese

Also try a Meta beer.

Extra tip, the creative loafing gift card area has $20 gift cards for 10 bucks!

We didn't expect a major car repair after moving to Texas a month ago, but when our 2009 Subaru Impreza broke down on our way home from Fort Worth, that's exactly what we encountered. Chris and the rest of the crew at McSpadden's were great! Hopefully we won't have anymore issues with our car, but if we do, we'll be going back for honest pricing and quality work. Thanks again Chris for all you do.

Food was great. 
Service was great. 
Bartender spilled a dark drink on my friends white pants (gasp!) but the manager immediately and without request came over and asked for her info in order to receive her dry cleaning bill.  Super great customer service.  
Though it's expensive you know what you're getting into when you go to the hotel.  I'll go back for sure!
I have come to conclude that all Steak and Shake restaurants are the worst Steak and Shake restaurants.

Visiting Atlanta and was craving some pie. Didn't realize most places close early. Found this place and loved it. I only had dessert which was delicious.  I had the strawberry rhubarb pie which was my favorite with ice cream. I also tried the peach and pecan pie which were good but not as good as the strawberry rhubarb.  Prices were very reasonable and staff was very friendly.

I've had better Indian food in bigger cities like London, but this is good for being in Texas.  The place was packed and it was a bit of a wait despite having reservations.  Food came out fairly quickly though.  Overall a good experience.

I bow down to your chef! Fantastic meal! I did take out and the ladies upfront we're superb; so sweet and efficient. The meal itself was so outstanding that my picky five year old ate every bite! Delicious and will be back again!!

P.S anyone who brags about their Instagram followers as a way to threaten a business loses all credibility with me..

This place is fantastic!

This place is awesome. Came to visit some friends in Boston and they took me here for lunch and a drink in between sight seeing. 25 cent wings at the bar were fantastic, service was great, servers friendly and the atmosphere was very chill and upbeat. Affordable and good. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

This is the first gym I ever got a membership to about a year and a half ago.  When signing up I explained to the manager that I worked out of town and if I decided to go work back up north that I wouldn't need my membership anymore.  He said he would make note of it and would cancel it himself even if I didn't move.  Four months in the manager left for another location without me knowing and when I tried to cancel my membership they told me I couldn't unless I actually moved my permanent residence somewhere where a Steve Nash was not located.  I guess that's what I get for taking someones word and ended up paying for it for another 8 months. 

Also, the parking is HORRIBLE! I have never seen worse.  Must have seen at least a half dozen accidents in that four months and if you go at a bad time your waiting 20 minutes or more for a spot.

The place is VERY busy too, sometimes it was even hard to get on a piece of equipment.

There were positives though.  It was one of the cleanest gyms I have been to and the staff was very friendly...

The tacos are great, but the patio area is constantly filthy and thus swarming with flies. Having to swat away flies after each bite is quite unappealing. Clean up the patio area and I'll increase my rating.

The cakes (especially the white chocolate and carrot) are good.  

But, as good as their cakes are, I can't help but be bothered by the fact that their customer service sucks... Smiles and greetings are rare, and godhelpyou if you should disrupt someone's conversation, phone call, email writing, or personal primping time by attempting to buy something or (gasp) ask for assistance.

I hate when the employees of a buisness are so stuck on the company's reputation that they feel they're better than you.  Their disdain for customers is almost palpable...

GET OVER YOUSELF HONEY,  YOU'RE SELLING CAKES..... NOT HANDING OUT DIAMONDS.

...try Matty Cakes or Metrotainment Bakery, service is friendlier, prices are more affordable and the cakes are just plain better.

I order a combo that comes with drink and french fries. I cant believe how unsanitary this place is. They handed me the drinks with the straw already in it. It made me feel uncomfortable , so i asked for a different drink and they give a hard time. I drove off and would never come back to this In and Out burger again.

I had the most wonderful experiece at Scott's on Alpine a couple of weekends ago.  I started with the house bloody Mary, and let's just say it was perfect!  A delicious blend of flavors, super fresh, beautiful garnish, a balance of spicy horseradish-meets-tomato-plus-vodka perfection.  My salad was one of the best nicoise salads I've ever had, with a healthy fillet of salmon instead of the usual tuna.  Everything was fresh and beaufitfully presented.  Last note on Scott's: the waitstaff was courteous, prompt and friendly.  We were even greeted by the owner, Doug, who made sure to check that all was okay

During our stay in Portland, our family ate here twice. 

1st visit: We got seated pretty quick, food was delicious, the service was okay....could have been a little faster (never came to refill our drinks until we asked for our check).

2nd visit: My kids loved their dinner pasta dish so much that they had me go back during their brunch time the following day.....

Because it was a special dinner item, they were able to made arrangements w/ the chef and made it happen for my kids.....

I've sent my buyers to work with Annie and the process was fantastic. As a broker, we rely on the mortgage professionals to help keep things moving. Most importantly is consistent communication and Annie's Team does that exceptionally well. Their ability to keep everyone informed and get deals closed is exactly what a broker wants and needs from their mortgage partners. Would highly recommend.

Let me begin by saying that I don't like German food. I hate sauerkraut and bratwurst and all that stuff. It's too heavy and it's not my thing. So I really wasn't expecting to like Schmidt's and was very pleasantly surprised when I did.

It's tucking away in German village. I'd never actually seen the place before because I don't venture around those parts much. But we were going here with the purpose of trying it out because I've heard so many good things. I wanted to be adventurous. 

The place was very busy. It was around 7 on a Thursday night. But I liked the atmosphere. Very German, but not overbearingly so. There were some men in liederhosen and they were the band that was playing German music. They did a few requests and popular songs German style. The Simpsons and Family Theme songs come to mind.

We couldn't come here and not try some of the beers. Some of what they have is from the Elevator's Brewery. I had the Hefeweizen all night. I was disappointed to find that they didn't have any sort of happy hour, but oh well. The beer was excellent and served with a lemon wedge on the glass.

We decided to try the Schmidt's Famous Pretzel Nuggets as an appetizer. But - our server forgot to put the order in and we didn't get them until after we already had our food. That kinda sucked. But they were delicious - they were fried, but no batter so they were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The sweet honey mustard dipping sauce was addicting.

I wasn't too sure what to order since I don't like German and just about everything on the menu was bratwurst and stuff like that. So I went with the Bahama Burger Special. The "Bahama Mama" is what this place is famous for. It's their specialty brat that's spicy. I wanted to try it, but wasn't sure. This dish comes with it in the form of a burger, so the cut is like a patty and there's no casing, which sounded good to me. It also came on a pretzel bun with tomato, onion and lettuce and swiss cheese. And guess what? I loved it. It was amazing. Not as spicy as I hoped, but I really liked it. I got the potato pancakes with applesauce as my side. They were good, little round cakes that were good dipped in the chunky applesauce. Yummy, but not all that great.

Jeff got the Bahama Mama platter, which came with cole slaw, potato salad, and was a huge brat on top of sauerkraut. It also came with a big toasted bun. He loved it.

For dessert we knew we had to get cream puffs. They are huge and look delicious - there is a display case filled with them right when you walk in the door. A clever marketing strategy if I ever saw one. It works. We were planning to share one but couldn't agree on one. So we got two, which ended up being insane because there was no way we could eat it all. He ate about half of his and I only managed about 5 or 6 bites of mine. Jeff got the chocolate one. It was a light fluffy sauce that wasn't at all too much chocolate. It was topped with powdered sugar and chocolate drizzle. I got the special buckeye one that was filled with light peanut butter cream and topped with this fudgy chocolate and nuts. Wonderful. I'm not a huge cream puff fan, but these were great.

Our server was nice. He gave us one of our cream puffs half off because of the appetizer trouble. I wish we just gave us the pretzels for free, though. At $5.25 per puff, we didn't get much of a discount. And our bill was crazy! About $70 for all this food and beer. I guess it wasn't awful, but still. I wish this place was cheaper, but I did have enough left over for another meal. Jeff didn't, though.

I will come back for sure, but I'll know that it can get pricey. But I was really impressed with how much I liked it despite my dislike for German foods. It won me over, but the appetizer service and prices knock one star off.

When the guys at Modern Energy installed my window treatments I would have given them 4/5 starts.  However since that time they have no-showed for a repair appointment, and I have not been able to get in touch with them.  It has been three weeks since I was last able to get in touch with them.

I decided to go to their store which is listed on Brazos Street.  No one in the building had seen or heard of Modern Energy.

This is shady and weird.  What gives?

Staff moves slow took a half an hour to get a carry out of a salad that had already been prepared , place was filthy it was disgusting I'm never going back to this Wendy's ever again.  Half of the people in line inside just got frustrated and left

There comes a time in a person's life where they give up and start throwing money at their problems. After a second baby, a return to work, and pneumonia, I had given up cleaning. My friend gave me her Revolutions Cleanings groupon and I gave them a call. I think the only downside of the experience was scheduling. They have 2 phone numbers and one doesn't have a voicemail box. The other one says "due to high call volume, please visit our website" (which makes no sense as the website has no place to contact them except through the phone). I got a call 2 days after my first voicemail and they scheduled something for the following week. The next day they called to reschedule for one day later. They texted me to confirm my address - smart because I didn't feel that we were understanding each other that well over the phone.
Then, when they were supposed to come, no one came. They were an hour and fifteen minutes late. I called, couldn't get ahold of anyone, and then got a call back explaining that the cleaners were running late. Fine, but if you knew that you should've called me. If I had time to sit around at home waiting for someone to come over I'd be cleaning my own damn house.
I have 2 kids and a hairy dog. My house hadn't been cleaned in a month. It was filthy. I expected with a 3 hour groupon they'd do the 2 bathrooms and I would feel like a new person. Maybe they'd sweep the kitchen. Boy was I wrong. Two people came and worked for 2 hours (which is really like FOUR hours on a 3hr groupon, so AWESOME) and they did 2 bathrooms, 1 kitchen, and tidied up in 3 bedrooms. We're talking top to bottom in the bathrooms - windows, mirrors, toilets, sinks, tub grout, EXHAUST FANS ARE YOU KIDDING I LOVE YOU. The kitchen was sparkly and clean in a way I'd never seen it. They cleaned the stainless steel everywhere. I think I should probably do that, it really does look nice. They cleaned the toaster and the microwave. I went to get dishwasher detergent and discovered they'd cleaned out the nasty cupboard under the sink. They cleaned the plastic drippy thing you put your hand washed dishes on. In the bedrooms, they dusted every surface including the ceiling fans. They made all of our beds. I'm sure there is even more I have yet to discover, but I was impressed they did the two bathrooms so well - everything else is icing on the cake. I'd give them 5 stars but this is just the first time.
